system.biography:
TitleFFF 305-1 Charcoaler
Birthday14 Larane 669
AppearanceAge 50, height 6’0”, light frame, weight 158 lb, plain appearance, dark complexion, silver hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheAddiction (Alcohol) WIL×3 to resist first drink
Size7
ArmorPlain cloth tunic and leggings, leather belt and shoes, sling and club. A team of horses and a wagon.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box.
ValuablesNothing in coin.
Notes

Biography

Edlin was born into his profession. The latest in a long line of charcoalers, Edlin had a nomadic and lonely childhood. His family have been the official charcoalers of the earl for more than a century and therefore have permission to cut down wood on any of his manors. Making enough charcoal for the earl’s use (to heat his castle, fire h forges, etc) takes a lot of wood. The charcoalers move from site to site so as not to denude an entire woodlot. In addition to making charcoal, charcoalers need to be experts in trees and timber so their harvesting remains sustainable.

Over the course of his life, Edlin has travelled widely within the shire. He knows all of the earl’s woodlots intimately. Although he is not a tracker or hunter, he knows every inch of his home turf and has an excellent memory. If you can describe a location he has been to, he can take you there. All he asks in return is some ale or the coin to buy it.

The charcoaler is good at his job and a very hard worker, but his will is weak. He is easily intimidated and cannot resist alcohol. His addiction has cost him his wife and children, who left many years ago. Fortunately, his profession is not one with a frequent payout. He works autumn and winter felling trees and hauling logs. In the spring, he tends to his small plot. Finally, in the summer, he builds his piles and cooks the charcoal. When it is ready, he loads his wagon and hauls it to the castle. The chamberlain knows him well and does not pay him a single silver penny until all the charcoal is delivered. As soon as he is paid, Edlin gets drunk and stays drunk until he runs out of coin.

Adventure Hooks

Lost In The Woods: The PCs don’t know where they are. After wandering aimlessly, they are discovered by a friendly charcoaler who leads them back to his cottage and then to civilization. All he asks is for the PCs to take him out for a night of drinking.

Something Heavy To Move: The PCs have found something deep in the woods that they can’t move themselves. Edlin is a good horse wrangler and has a team of sturdy draft horses that can skid a large log out of the woods. He is recommended to the PCs.

A Treasure Map: The PCs find a map to a treasure hidden in the forest. What they don’t know is that Edlin found the treasure long ago and has been taking a little at a time to fund his addiction. He won’t take kindly to strangers invading his forest and taking “his” hoard. He knows these woods very well.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
